catalogue module

Module with functionality for keeping track of the parameters used for different runs of numerical calculations. The outside interface consists of the Parameters class and the catalogue_parameters function. The rest are intended only for use internal within this module.

class catalogue.Parameters

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for storing parameters for numerical calculations.

When combined with the catalogue_parameters function, all attributes not starting with an underscore (_) will be treated as model parameters and saved to the registry. Callable methods will be ignored.

Magic method __str__ must be overridden. This defines the name given to the directory in which parameters and results will be catalogued and saved.

abstract __str__() → str

Defines the name of the type of simulation.

Returns:

the desired name of the type of simulation you are running.

Return type:

(str)

catalogue.append_sample(path: str, parameters: Parameters) → str

Create an id for the new sample and append it to the registry.

The new id will be one number larger than the previous sample, even if there are intermittent samples missing. The first sample in a fresh registry is 1000.

Parameters:

  • path (str) – the path to the directory in which the registry and samples are stored.

  • parameters (Parameters) – the parameters to the simulation which should be stored.

Returns:

the id of the new sample

Return type:

(str)

catalogue.catalogue_parameters(parent_dir: str, parameters: Parameters) → Path

Save the parameters passed as input to the registry file.

Parameters:

  • parent_dir (str) – the directory in which the parameters and results will be saved.

  • parameters (subclass of Parameters) – instance of a subclass of the Parameter class which has the parameters for the numerical calculations as instance variables.

Returns:

full path to the directory in which results for this particular

calculation should be saved.

Return type:

(str)

catalogue.create_html_registry(path: str)

Create an HTML copy of the CSV registry using Pandas.

catalogue.create_registry_files(path: str, parameters: Parameters)
catalogue.extract_parameters(p: Parameters) → Dict[str, Union[str, int, float, bool]]

Extract the parameters from an instance of the Parameter class.

Parameters:

p (Parameters) – the hyperparameters of a numerical calculation.

Returns:

the parameters as a dictionary on

the form {parameter name: parameter value}

Return type:

(Dict[str, Union[str, int, float]])
